page.syntax: Code as C = a5_dictionary_read(C dictionary ,C type ,C name [,L delete [,L lBlob [,C extendedAction [,C newName ]]]])

argument.name: dictionary
argument.description: The name of a dictionary file containing a toolbar. Character

argument.name: name
argument.description: The name of the toolbar object. Character

page.description: Reads a record from a data ditionary. If lBlob is .T., value is returned as a blob. ExtendedAction can be '', 'Rename' or 'SaveAs'
page.discussion: The A5_DICTIONARY_READ() reads the Xbasic code associated with a toolbar or menu from a dictionary file. Limitations: Desktop applications only.

section.title: Example
section.description: The following script reads the contents of a toolbar named mainmenu into a character variable.
The following script writes the code ( newtb ) for a toolbar named mainmenu into the dictionary file Alphasports.Alb.
